amendment.description: Amendment, as modified, makes technical and clarifying changes relating to best practices of charter schools and the Federal formula allocation during the first year and for successive enrollment expansions.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to clarify that state distribution of information about the best charter school practices should be done with minimum paper work by the school and the state, and require that new and expanding charter schools receive all the federal funds they are eligible for within the first five months of opening.

action.text: Riggs amendment (A001) modified by unanimous consent.
On agreeing to the Riggs amendment (A001) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
